definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: When I was doing the housework, my husband telephoned me from the office.
sentences.chinese: 当我正在干家务时，我丈夫从办公室打电话给我。

sentences.english: She said to call a week to three days before leaving.
sentences.chinese: 请在您要离开前三至七天左右再打电话过来。

sentences.english: I'll call right now to find it out.
If I overslept because I am ill, I always call in absent to work –
sentences.chinese: 如果我睡过头是因为我生病了，我总会打电话请假。

sentences.english: Every time I call you, I got your administrative assistant.
sentences.chinese: 每次我给你打电话，都是你的助手接。

sentences.english: Thank you for calling Japan Airlines.
sentences.chinese: 感谢您打电话来日本航空公司。

sentences.english: They didn’t call the PO after the demo to check his feedback.
sentences.chinese: 他们在演示后甚至不会去给PO打电话了解反馈。

sentences.english: I called you at about half past eight last night , but nobody answered.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚八点半左右我打电话给你，但没人接。

sentences.english: Nan ning waiting to make a phone call, nothing but is nothing didnt call.
sentences.chinese: 楠宁等着沛打电话，可是沛就是没打来。

sentences.english: When making a phone call, which side have to hang up first?
sentences.chinese: 打电话时，应由哪一方先挂断？

sentences.english: When you call, ask for extension 3276.
It would be difficult for you to reach me by phone since I live in a student dormitory.
sentences.chinese: 由于我住在学生宿舍，你打电话很难找到我。

sentences.english: An old friend of mine just called.
We were on the point of telephoning you when your telegram arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我们正准备给你打电话，这时你的电报来了。

sentences.english: At that point he phoned me for aerial support.
sentences.chinese: 这时，他给我打电话要求空中定位支援。

sentences.english: Then she ran to the pay-phone to call the polices.
sentences.chinese: 她立刻跑到投币电话亭，打电话报警。

definition: to turn off (a machine or device)/to finish shooting a film
to reply to a telegram/to wire back
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn

incoming telegram or telephone call/your telegram, telephone call, or message/to send a telegram or make a telephone call here (i.e. to the speaker)/to have instant attraction to sb/to have chemistry with sb/to come back (of electricity, after an outage)
to reject/to refuse to take a call
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
